snippet.title: Mundial Ronaldinho Soccer 64 (Part 1)
snippet.description:
Hahahaha... Ronaldinho soccer! -Versão 1.0-

Game starts at/Juego comienza a/Jogo começa ao/Jeu commence à: 7:13

This is a romhack of a Nintendo 64 game called International Superstar Soccer 64. Believed to have been made in Peru, it seems to have been targeted at Brazil, and is named after a Brazilian soccer player named Ronaldo who seems to have been popular at the time. ...However, it seems there's confusion, there were TWO popular soccer players named Ronaldo (because the name is the Brazilian equivalent of Jon I guess). The second one was called Ronaldinho ("little Ronaldo") to differentiate him, but it seems they were mixed up anyway.

The game hasn't been changed that much, the text is even still in English. As far as I can tell, aside from the title the changes are to the roster, which I've heard is intended to reflect the players that were current when this was made, and the announcer, who has been redubbed into a language I believe is intended to be Brazilian Portuguese... however, since the creators are Peruvian, the pronunciation sounds very heavily Spanish, and some words are just Spanish instead of Portuguese, like Japón instead of Japão. It ends up sounding more like a weird Spanish-Portuguese creole instead of actual Portuguese. It sounds really freaking hilarious if you speak either language.

Ronaldinho Soccer actually seems to be an entire series of made-for-Brazil redubbed soccer game romhacks... yeah, they love futebol. Would be interesting to check out the others some time.

And remember... GOLAÇO! GOLAÇO! GOLAÇO GOLAÇO!
